author: donschoe
content: is there any reason we do most protocol upgrades during pacific timezones recently?

author: timbeiko
content: We need the epoch to be divisible by 8192, which happens every ~27h

author: timbeiko
content: so if you aim for the middle of a week, you get like 2-3 potential options for timing

author: donschoe
content: interesting!

author: jgm
content: Epoch, or slot?

author: ralexstokes
content:
epoch % 256, slot % 8192
256 divides 8192 so if my modular math is on point we can just make sure everything aligns 256

author: timbeiko
content:
ACDE TL;DW: 

- **Shapella Mainnet scheduled for April 12 (epoch: 194048    slot: 6209536    UTC: 4/12/2023, 10:27:35 PM)**
- Clients seem to like https://github.com/ethereum/execution-apis/pull/388, but agreed to not implement it for Shanghai, despite requiring more EngineAPI modifications by delaying
- We discussed the status of all Cancun proposed EIPs so far (list here: https://ethereum-magicians.org/t/cancun-network-upgrade-meta-thread/12060). Some things that came up:
    - SSZ: Teams hesitant to do a wholesale transition during Cancun, but we still need to figure out (1) how to make the 4844 txn type forward compatible, (2) what breaks on-chain when we move the transactions to SSZ encoding and (3) if we want to do more than the 4844 txn type for Cancun (i.e. update the withdrawal root). We can discuss in <#779922457631916064> and will share updates on the next ACDE
    - SELFDESTRUCT removal: teams would like to see it in Cancun, but we need a spec that deals with the edge cases. Can use <#688075293562503241> to discuss. 
    - EVMMAX: Now have two proposals, one with and one without EOF. 
    - EOF: no major updates on the call, conversations continuing in <#706868829900505180> and breakout rooms
    - BLS: important to help liquid staking pools, should be considered independently of EVMMAX
    - EIP-1153: tests merged in ethereum/tests, some client devs supportive for Cancun
    - EIP-4788: simple addition that also makes things better for liquid staking pools
    - EIP-663: updated to be EOF-compatible, should be part of EOFv1
    - EIP-5920: skepticism about the value add of this

Over the next few weeks, client teams should think through priorities for the fork. Also, if you have a candidate Cancun EIP, now is the time to make it known üòÑ 

And, lastly, Pooja went over the EthCatHerders node operator survey that just came out: https://medium.com/ethereum-cat-herders/exploring-ethereums-client-ecosystem-afc9affa84dd

author: timbeiko
content: ... and we managed to finish the call early !

author: axic3354
content:
Here's a new version of my selfdestruct proposal (EIP-6046): https://notes.ethereum.org/@ipsilon/HJFA-Bkg2

This fixes the problem of "pre-existing storage" by shadowing old storage. From a users' perspective there is no change how selfdestruct behaves and so it won't cause any risk of bricking contracts.

This version is mostly made with Verkle trees in mind, it's goal is to remove this last bottleneck for Verkle trees, and in fact to minimize number of changes one should consider introducing it together with Verkle trees and not before (see the account changes).
